title: South Africa: Kenya Airports Authority Apron Buses Were Smuggled, Says Board
text:
The buses, whose tender approval was granted in 2011, were acquired through an open tender awarded at a cost of $120,000 (Sh11.9 million) per month. 
The payments were stopped after President Uhuru Kenyatta ordered investigations into the deal. 
Relief and Logistics produced an RTGS transfer from National Bank Kilindini branch dated January to KRA for taxes amounting to Sh25.8 million. 
The company requested to meet the Transport Committee to clear its name. 
Appearing before the committee, Kimaiyo further claimed that the contract was awarded without the board’s approval. 
But KAA former managing director Lucy Mbugua told the same committee two weeks ago the board approved the transaction and tabled minutes as well. 
“The process was above board and the best deal was procured with the approval of the board,” she said. 
But yesterday, Kimaiyo insisted the board was not informed. 
“The MD misled us to believe the buses would be owned by KAA and leased to a third party to run and maintain them,” Kimaiyo said. 
“But after realising that we were operating buses that we do not own, we ordered investigations immediately.” 
He said the board in April ordered the agency’s audit and risk management committee to probe the matter, then blew the whistle after touring the facility. 
“We were made to believe that one bus arrived in November and another four would be in the country in time for the commissioning by the President,” Kimaiyo said. 
“But after it became clear that there was a mega scandal, the agenda was deleted from the President’s itinerary, pending investigations.” 
Kimaiyo assured Kenyans no money was lost in the deal. South Africa
